parrot.tip: you can generate reports from ontologies expressed in multiple formats (RDF/XML, Turtle, N-Triples, N3, RDFa).
you can generate reports from rule documents expressed in multiple formats (RIF XML and RIF PS).
there is a help page that describes which meta-data properties are supported by Parrot.
you can read all tips in compilation
with Parrot you can generate a report uploading a file.
you can simply paste your OWL or RIF document into the 'Direct input' tab.
there is RDFa embedded into the Parrot reports.
some commonly used ontologies are recognized by their prefix (try 'foaf' in the URI field!). Kudos to http://prefix.cc/
if the file type is not correctly detected, you can force your own MIME type.
if your ontologies and rules contain multilingual documentation, you can pick one using 'Advanced options'.
you can return from a report to this form by pressing the button in the bottom toolbar.
the bottom toolbar makes it easy to navigate your reports.
you can hide or show different parts of your reports.
you can save the report as an XHTML file using the 'File' menu of your web browser.
you can generate a PDF version of the report by printing it to a PDF file.
there is a Parrot plugin for Eclipse. Just add the eclipse update site
